messages.content: What was fixed in version 0.2.1 of comfyui-dynamicprompts?
In version 0.2.1 of comfyui-dynamicprompts, a bug was fixed due to a backwards incompatible change in the latest version of dynamicprompts that returns a SampleResult instead of a str.
What new feature was introduced in version 0.2.0 of comfyui-dynamicprompts?
In version 0.2.0 of comfyui-dynamicprompts, nodes were updated to have settable seeds for reproducibility.
Who provided the inspiration for the settable seeds feature in version 0.2.0 of comfyui-dynamicprompts?
The inspiration for the settable seeds feature in version 0.2.0 of comfyui-dynamicprompts came from @romeobuilderotti.
Which version of dynamicprompts was comfyui-dynamicprompts upgraded to in version 0.2.0?
In version 0.2.0 of comfyui-dynamicprompts, dynamicprompts was upgraded to v0.30.1.
What was changed in version 0.1.3 of comfyui-dynamicprompts?
In version 0.1.3 of comfyui-dynamicprompts, wildcards in the ComfyUI root were supported for backwards compatibility.
Where does the extension look for wildcards as of version 0.1.2 of comfyui-dynamicprompts?
As of version 0.1.2 of comfyui-dynamicprompts, the extension looks for wildcards in custom_nodes/comfyui_dynamicprompts/wildcards.
What was changed in version 0.1.1 of comfyui-dynamicprompts?
In version 0.1.1 of comfyui-dynamicprompts, the code was changed to use relative imports, which fixed issue #1 on the GitHub repository.
What is ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts?
ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts is a custom nodes library that integrates into your existing ComfyUI Library and provides nodes that enable the use of Dynamic Prompts in your ComfyUI.
Which nodes are provided by the ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts library?
The nodes provided by the ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts library are: Random Prompts, Combinatorial Prompts, I'm Feeling Lucky, Magic Prompt, and Jinja2 Templates.
How can you install ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts using ComfyUI-Manager?

To install ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts using ComfyUI-Manager, first install ComfyUI-Manager if it isn't already. Then, press Install Custom Nodes from the ComfyUI-Manager menu, search for dynamicprompts, and click install.
What are the steps for manual installation of ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts?

The manual installation of ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts involves cloning the repository, installing the required Python packages, running install.py, creating a wildcards directory, optionally downloading a wildcard collection, and restarting ComfyUI.
Where does the ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts extension look for wildcard files?
The ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts extension looks for wildcard files in custom_nodes/comfyui-dynamicprompts/wildcards.
What type of outputs do nodes in the ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts library produce?
All nodes in the ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts library produce a String output that can typically be passed into Clip Text Encode Prompts. Both positive and negative nodes are supported.
What is the behavior of the Combinatorial Prompt generation in ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts?

The Combinatorial Prompt generation in ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts iterates through all possible values in a cycle. For example, A {red|green|blue} ball will generate the sequence: A red ball, A green ball, A blue ball, A red ball, and so on.
What are some known limitations of the current release of ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts?

The current release of ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts has some known limitations such as non-configurable random seeds, inability to select the MagicPrompt model, absence of several other configuration features, and the only way to view the generated prompt is through console output.
